December 21

  • Feature: Desktop app version 1.6.11: Any emails in your documents from the old Gmail plugin that are stuck “Loading…” will be fixed when you click to open the email

December 20

  • Fix: The first character on a line in an Asian language was incorrect
  • Fix: Typing in Asian languages was sometimes not updating caret position
  • Fix: Typing in Asian languages was sometimes doubling text in Safari

Mobile

  • Fix: Autocorrect works much better

December 15

Email sync is back! See the blog post for details.

  • Feature: Full sync with Gmail in the new Email Pane which can pull in multiple Gmail accounts, has a unified All Accounts inbox, supports forwarding and replying to messages, and composing new messages. It displays and composes emails using Gmail so it’s full-featured and familiar.
  • Fix: The Mac app was sometimes crashing on Big Sur when authenticating Gmail if you declined Bluetooth permissions
  • Fix: ! after a prefix in the add item popup was sometimes not showing the date picker
  • Fix: Context menus and modal menus were sometimes blocking clicks on buttons outside of them
  • Change: Updated the Mac app icon for Big Sur

Mobile

  • Fix: Autocorrect works better

December 4

  • Fix: Shift + left arrow was not working for some people
  • Fix: Dates could display twice if immediately following a tag with no space

December 1

Big update! New mobile app along with some desktop improvements. See the blog post for details.

Mobile

  • Feature: Inbox Pane and Files Pane support
  • Feature: Code blocks support
  • Feature: New date picker with easier repeat date selection
  • Feature: The mobile app now uses a board called “Mobile” which you can modify in the web/desktop version
  • Change: The top bar works more like the web app, shrinking when you scroll down, and now has a back button.
  • Change: All of the menus are now bottom sheets that go fullscreen if the keyboard is open. This makes it easier to quickly preview notes and dates without a full screen navigation.
  • Change: Autocomplete is now an inline popup instead of a full screen navigation
  • Speed: Generally feels faster, smoother, and more stable
  • Speed: Improved load time, especially if you have large deleted documents

Desktop

  • Feature: Links can now be used without the http:// so for example just moo.do will parse as a link
  • Fix: Selection was sometimes not expanding into children correctly
  • Fix: Overview not immediately showing deleted documents in the Trash after deleting
  • Fix: Calendar was sometimes not correctly scrolling to Today
  • Fix: Deleting an item synced to Google Calendar by hotkey or menu was sometimes not removing it from Google Calendar
  • Fix: Toolbar boards were not scrollable
  • Fix: Closing a note was not always restoring selection correctly
  • Speed: Improved performance of animations: context menu and modal menu opening, panes, pane headers, and pane items
  • Speed: Improved load time, especially if you have large deleted documents

November 3

  • Fix: Typing in the Move To menu with multiple items selected was deleting the selected items
  • Fix: Moving a hierarchy of items with the Move To menu was losing the hierarchy

October 9

  • Fix: Backspace and delete sometimes dropping item dates
  • Fix: Disabling the Drive plugin was sometimes not immediately updating the checkbox
  • Fix: Occasional failure to scroll to the previously zoomed item when zooming out

September 27

  • Fix: The Drive plugin was sometimes not loading files saved to panes
  • Fix: Drive data coming in remotely was not immediately updating the rendered item
  • Fix: Drive files stuck as “Loading…” are still clickable to open in Drive
  • Fix: The Drive plugin was not syncing immediately after signing in for users who’ve cancelled Premium
  • Fix: Numbered list exports use the actual number and tasks use [ ] or [x] if complete
  • Fix: Item linking autocomplete now selects the first item by default
  • Fix: Invoices were not scrollable
  • Change: Exporting a plugin exports as with its link to its service

September 26

  • Fix: date:none filter was not working correctly
  • Fix: Switching between Outline and List views was not updating pane history correctly

September 20

  • Fix: Changing the filter in Calendar panes was scrolling into the past

September 17

  • Fix: Pasting a file/image was inserting after the selected item
  • Fix: Typo in confirm delete message
  • Fix: Crash on load if a saved email had no messages

September 12

  • Fix: Crash dropping emails on tag pane headers
  • Feature: Global search now runs the same search code as pane filters so it supports all the same features, including quotes and dates

September 10

  • Fix: Rewrote selection to track by item id instead of index, which makes selection generally more stable
  • Feature: Cmd + Click on Mac or Ctrl + Click on Windows to select multiple (non-contiguous) items
  • Speed: Much improved scrolling performance - it looks smoother while scrolling, especially in Safari or Firefox on slower computers.

September 3

  • Fix: Collapse all was not working sometimes in Project view
  • Fix: Completing an item matching text filter in a pane hiding complete items would briefly flash its hidden siblings briefly

September 1

  • Feature: All plugins support multiple accounts now - added multiple account support for Contacts and Drive
  • Fix: Plugin sync was sometimes delayed up to 30 seconds after load

August 30

  • Fix: Code blocks no longer parse formatting, links, tags, or contacts

August 29

  • Feature: Add Tab as a key to select out of autocomplete
  • Fix: Copying was sometimes duplicating prefixes

August 28

  • Fix: The collapse all button wasn’t working sometimes

August 20

  • Fix: data:images were sometimes not parsing correctly
  • Fix: Some new users signing up by email were getting stuck on Connecting…

August 14

  • Fix: Emails in the Inbox were sometimes not loading if the Gmail plugin was still enabled but not syncing
  • Fix: Inbox panes were crashing sometimes on malformed emails

August 6

  • Speed: Moved a fix only for old browsers to load only if required, which shaves 548 KB (or 15%) off the app size

August 5

  • Feature: Global Search - Press Cmd + Shift + F on Mac or Ctrl + Shift + F on Windows/Linux to open a global search popup. This can either scroll to the selected item or zoom to it. And it can open in the current pane, a new pane, or a popup pane. See the blog post for details.
  • Fix: Long pane heading were sometimes taking up two lines even if only displaying on one line

July 30

  • Feature: Normal Search - Press Cmd + F on Mac or Ctrl + F on Windows/Linux to open a normal text search which scrolls to search results. This was previously the hotkey for Filter, which is changed to Ctrl + F on Mac or Alt + F on Windows/Linux.
  • Fix: The Chrome extension and Gmail addon are updated to not require selecting a document to save to
  • Fix: The Chrome extension login button did not immediately update the UI
  • Fix: Inbox Pane now loads only the most recently updated emails (to save bandwidth usage)
  • Fix: Completing emails in the Inbox Pane was not immediately hiding them
  • Fix: Added Cmd + Enter on Mac or Ctrl + Enter completing hotkey in the Inbox Pane to match other panes
  • Fix: Filtering was not scrolling to the top if text was highlighted

July 27

  • Fix: Dropping an non-matching item on a filtered pane appeared to do nothing
  • Fix: Text filters were breaking rendering of code blocks

July 26

  • Fix: Some malformed emails were not loading correctly
  • Fix: Empty items were not clickable in Safari
  • Fix: Signing into an account with an encryption password was asking for the password twice

July 24

  • Feature: Code blocks! See the blog post for details.
  • Fix: Crash on load in some rare cases of malformed emails
  • Fix: Cutting inline text was making subsequent UI updates appear to have no effect

July 23

  • Fix: Cmd + Backspace after escaped markdown was deleting one at a time instead of the whole line
  • Fix: Dropping at the bottom of a pane was not working since the recent big update
  • Fix: Stop adding prefixes to text while copying unless the whole item is selected
  • Fix: Added a button for the Gmail Addon to plugin settings
  • Speed: More performance improvements to scrolling

July 21

  • Fix: Deleting one item from non-Outline views was showing a message about deleting multiple items
  • Fix: Calculating today’s date was wrong if today was the start of the week
  • Fix: Moved context menus above toasts
  • Speed: Improved smoothness of scrolling on slower devices

July 20

  • Fix: iOS and Android apps updated with all the latest fixes

July 19

  • Fix: Repeated reauthenticate messages: We’re now doing Google plugin authentication in a new way, storing refresh tokens in the database (encrypted) instead of depending on Google’s client-side authentication, which has degraded into reporting many users as signed out and causing reauthentication messages. Moo.do will continue to use the old method as long as it works for you, but if you reauthenticate it will use the new method and should fix this for good. If you prefer to use the old method for some reason, you can disable “Use new authentication” in the General settings.
  • Fix: Email messages that were migrated from the Gmail plugin were sometimes not loading

July 12

  • Fix: Panes were sometimes scrolling down on the first keypress
  • Fix: The Demo button in Help was not working
  • Fix: Deleting a document and then encrypting another document was causing a broken state on other devices because there were no accessible documents

July 11

  • Feature: Added strikethrough formatting. It’s in the formatting toolbar and uses the hotkey Cmd + Shift + X on Mac or Ctrl + Shift + X on Windows/Linux. And in Markdown, wrap the text in ~~.

July 10

  • Fix: Some issues from the last update with Chinese input

July 8

This is the biggest single update we’ve ever had! See the blog post for details.

  • Change: Redesigned pane headers, with big bold breadcrumbs
  • Change: Indent alignment is changed to align to text instead of prefixes. If you prefer the old way, there’s any option in the Display Settings.
  • Change: Pressing Tab or Shift + Tab indents the item and its subtree. If you want to indent just the single item, use + [ and + ].
  • Feature: A new Inbox Pane, which shows emails saved by the Chrome Extension and Gmail Add-On
  • Feature: Multiple Font options in the Display Settings, defaulting to San Francisco on Mac, Segoe UI on Windows, and Noto Sans on Linux
  • Feature: Added support for Base64 images. Just paste in a data:image and you’ll see a pretty picture.
  • Feature: Added OPML support. It’s now an option in the import and export windows, and is also supported in paste.
  • Feature: Added support for file:/// urls for linking to local files
  • Feature: Added === as a heavy divider line, in addition to — which is a light divider line
  • Feature: Search for date: any to match items with any date
  • Feature: Search fordate: none for items with no date
  • Feature: Use quotes in date searches to for more complex dates like after:”June 20”
  • Feature: A new between search for for showing dates in a range, like between:today,today+3
  • Feature: Added a message to the top of the Drive pane to select items from Drive
  • Feature: Added edit and remove link options to the context menu on links
  • Fix: Tons of fixes to text formatting, including bugs in searching for text that had formats in it, formatting around prefixes, pressing enter in the middle of formatted text, etc… It should be rock solid now.
  • Fix: If you have “Show Markdown” disabled, * and _ characters no longer mess with formatting
  • Fix: Paste has been rewritten from scratch and works much better
  • Fix: Undo/redo is generally more stable and restores selection better
  • Fix: Search for dates was buggy in some cases with recurring dates
  • Fix: Clicking links no longer requires holding a modifier key
  • Fix: Images work better, specifically editing around them and resizing them
  • Fix: Moving items between documents now moves them directly (instead of deleting the old items and creating new items) which is faster and fixes it breaking internal links
  • Fix: Sorting boards is generally better, more nicely animated, and is faster
  • Fix: The document renaming popup starts with the current name
  • Fix: Item animations are much smoother
  • Fix: Inputting accented characters was sometimes not working
  • Fix: All the places that show today’s date change automatically after midnight more consistently
  • Fix: Linked items were showing up as false positives in searches
  • Speed: Pane and item rendering is rewritten from scratch so working in panes generally feels smoother, resizing panes and scrolling feels smoother, and load time is improved
  • Speed: Resizing calendar events is much faster (it was previously modifying the item while resizing, and now it waits until it’s finished resizing)

July 2

  • Feature: Emails saved into documents with the Gmail plugin (not your whole inbox, just any emails saved to documents) are migrated over to our email integration, so that saved emails will continue to work after Google disables the Gmail plugin on July 8. See the blog post for more details of how we are adapting email in Moo.do because of Google’s new policies. And we have big improvements to the new email integration coming soon.

June 6

Mobile

  • Fix: Pasting certain text was crashing sometimes
  • Fix: Occasional crash in calendar menu

May 25

  • Fix: Improved handling of panes whose active documents were deleted in another board

May 22

  • Feature: Support pasting OPML
  • Feature: New OPML export option in Export Data menu
  • Fix: Complex nested formatting was sometimes not rendering properly
  • Fix: Parsing HTML with nested formatting
  • Fix: Paste was stripping spans of multiple spaces
  • Fix: OPML import was breaking formatting characters and slow

May 21

  • Fix: Formatting and notes were sometimes not pasting correctly from Workflowy
  • Fix: Paste was stripping out whitespace

May 19

  • Fix: Paste from Outlook was sometimes not formatting corrrectly
  • Fix: Pasted images ending in a query string (like ?width=120) were not recognized as images

May 12

Mobile

  • Feature: Dark mode! Moo.do will now use the system dark mode setting, and Moo.do has a new setting to choose light or dark mode
  • Change: The keyboard toolbar is now two rows and the buttons show the state for the selected item
  • Change: Bottom tabs always show text instead of only when selected, and they’re now white with a light shadow
  • Fix: Editing text generally works much more smoothly
  • Fix: Search waits to update until the keyboard is closed so it won’t hide items while typing
  • Fix: Some items were measuring incorrectly and overflowing onto another line unnecessarily
  • Fix: On Android, tapping an item sometimes moved the keyboard toolbar into the wrong place
  • Fix: On iOS, the keyboard coming up was hiding the status bar
  • Fix: Scrolling the tapped item into place is faster and smoother
  • Fix: The overview drawer was sometimes flashing gray while the app opened
  • Fix: Setting a time before setting a date sometimes caused a crash
  • Fix: Added items were not using the default prefix
  • Fix: The app could get stuck on Updating… after clearing app data
  • Fix: Tapping a note in multiselect now selects its parent item
  • Fix: Increased vertical spacing in the Agenda so it doesn’t crop times
  • Speed: Improved load time when Gmail plugin is enabled

May 10

  • Feature: New Gmail Add-On for saving emails to Moo.do from Gmail in any browser and even the Gmail iOS and Android apps. See blog post for details.

May 9

  • Fix: A brand new copy/paste system which supports more complex hierarchies and embedded images, and fixes many bugs in the old pasting system. Please let us know if you see any issues with copy/paste after this update.

May 5

  • Feature: Panes have a back button at the top left. This responds to changes in zoomed item, search, and filter changes.
  • Feature: Clicking a linked item will navigate the current pane to it. + Click will open in a popup, and + Shift + Click will open it in a new pane. See the options on hovering the linked item.
  • Feature: Search matches against linked items
  • Feature: If a linked item is blank, the link says “(Linked item has no text)”
  • Feature: If deleting an item that is linked to, it will confirm before deleting
  • Feature: A link to a deleted item says “(Deleted item)”
  • Fix: Don’t allow dropping on empty items, only above or below

May 2

  • Fix: Adding a local document was adding an empty synced document, with colliding duplicate ids
  • Fix: Trash in overview is collapsed by default
  • Fix: Pasting from Slack now handles Slack’s strangely formatted line breaks properly
  • Fix: Setting star or priority no longer removes complete

May 1

  • Fix: Reduced the occurrence of messages about failed authentication
  • Fix: OneNote icon was missing on OneNote app links
  • Fix: Syncing changes to text and date at the same time was sometimes causing dates to go missing or text to revert
  • Fix: Clicking a date in the date popup was sometimes moving the event forward 30 minutes or resetting the duration
  • Fix: Boards were sometimes sorting differently when hovered
  • Fix: Panes were sometimes not animating into place in the desktop app
  • Fix: Maximizing an email compose window wasn’t going fullscreen
  • Change: All of the animations (pane position, opening overview, opening menus) should be nicer and smoother
  • Change: Maximizing an email compose window animates to fullscreen

April 23

  • Fix: Syncing changes to an item’s text and date at the same time was sometimes causing dates to go missing or text to revert

April 19

Mobile

  • Feature: Pressing enter scrolls the new item above the keyboard
  • Fix: Editing text around plugin items works much better
  • Fix: Plugin items were not measuring correctly, so items with plugins could overflow onto an invisible second line
  • Fix: Pressing enter at the end of an item with a plugin was not working
  • Fix: Pressing backspace to delete an empty item was not selecting the end of the previous item if it had a prefix
  • Fix: Account settings legacy options were not starting with the saved setting

April 14

Mobile

  • Speed: Massive improvment to load time of Email pane
  • Fix: Closing an email preview was sometimes crashing the Android app

April 12

  • Feature: New Overview design, combining the Documents and Overview into one large hierarchy. See blog post for details.

April 4

  • Feature: New Chrome extension for adding emails to Moo.do from Gmail and for saving the current page as a link in Moo.do. See blog post for details.

April 3

  • Fix: Text editing was sometimes janky on Android

March 31

  • Feature: Added a “Use Legacy Drive” option to plugin settings. For those of you who had enabled the Drive plugin a while ago and it stopped showing the full contents of your Drive, enabling this should show the full contents again.
  • Fix: Moo.do was always popping out to the login screen for some users with an email-only account and no name set, then showing a bunch of crashes after logging in.
  • Fix: The menu to upload a file or image was not uploading correctly
  • Fix: Detect having local documents with the same ID as synced documents
  • Fix: Clicking context menus close to the bottom of the screen was auto clicking the item below the mouse

March 18

  • Fix: Google suddenly started sending differently formatted responses sometimes, which was breaking sync with Google services

March 15

  • Fix: Some calendar views being empty
  • Fix: Scroll offset of today was sometimes wrong, and was the root cause of other problems
  • Fix: Day width calculations were sometimes slightly wrong so the last day of the week would overflow
  • Fix: The last week of each month in month view didn’t have a bottom border
  • Fix: Changing the start of the week now updates the items in the month view
  • Fix: Dates were sometimes not updating properly when the date changed

March 12

  • Fix: Item text was (very rarely) being saved with a ? character in iOS app

March 6

  • Fix: A sync issue where in some edge cases synced changes would not display correctly until reload
  • Fix: Items were still being initialized in deleted documents
  • Fix: Internal links in imported documents were being broken by ID regenerating

March 1

  • Feature: Sync collapsed state across devices

February 22

  • Fix: Sign in button on login screen was sometimes opening the wrong popup
  • Fix: Reauthorization errors could have been caused by a bad internet connection, or resuming from suspend. So it tries to ensure you’re online before authorizing, and shows a retry button which will likely fix it. Successful authorizations now clear the messages.

February 20

  • Fix: Drive pane was not loading correctly for email/password accounts

February 18

  • Fix: Gmail labels with duplicate names were sometimes not syncing correctly
  • Fix: Gmail syncs immediately after updating sync accounts
  • Fix: First load on a new device was sometimes showing incorrect Gmail labels until refresh

February 15

  • Fix: Searched email panes were getting stuck in Loading on refresh

February 14

  • Fix: Some users were seeing repeated reauthorization messages

February 13

  • Fix: When sharing a document the list of collaborators was sometimes not updating immediately
  • Fix: Email panes were sometimes not loading their labels list if using email signin and the overview was open on load

February 12

  • Fix: Collapse and expand were not working correctly in all views
  • Fix: Dragging an item with a tag onto a tag block with a similar name was not working

February 11

  • Fix: Email compose windows were not expanding for their content

February 10

  • Feature: Dragging an item with an email onto an Email pane will apply the label of that pane
  • Fix: Dragging emails onto labels in overview
  • Fix: Icons in email overview were not spaced correctly

February 9

  • Fix: Item date sync was not properly syncing their Google Calendar info. This could have resulted in items not knowing they’re synced to calendar, and creating duplicates on the calendar. If you’re seeing mismatched calendar events, signing out and back in should fix it. And then it shouldn’t happen again.
  • Fix: Syncing calendar colors tries to ensure unique colors. It was sometimes getting the same color if a calendar was in multiple accounts.
  • Fix: With multiple sync accounts it was sometimes considering the wrong one as the primary account
  • Fix: “undefined” was somehow getting into the sync accounts list

February 7

  • Feature: Email/password signin: In the “Moo.do Account” section of Settings, you can manage which signin methods are linked to your account. The login page now has two buttons, for Google and email signin. See blog post for details.
  • Feature: A new setting (enabled by default) to sync new events to the default Google Calendar by default
  • Fix: Some calendar sync errors were not being handled correctly

January 31

  • Feature: Backspace key and an X button to clear hotkey settings
  • Fix: Desktop app hotkey settings were broken by the hotkeys update
  • Fix: Escape key was not working in note editor
  • Fix: Escape key cancels out of hotkey input

January 27

  • Feature: Template sharing: Right click on a Board Folder and select “Save as Public Template”. This will let you name the template and then give you a URL you can share. This creates a copy of all of the documents in those boards, which does not stay in sync. You can update the template by saving it again.
  • Feature: Multiselect drag/drop: when you highlight multiple items you can drag and drop all of them.
  • Feature: Custom Hotkeys: See the Settings for a new Hotkeys page where you can set your own hotkeys. This is a Premium feature.
  • Feature: Added a new demo page: https://www.moo.do/demo/
  • Speed: Reduced app size by 1.07 MB (23%)
  • Fix: Deleting the end of a line before a prefixed item was including its prefix

January 18

Mobile

  • Feature: Can now add documents
  • Feature: Added a no priority button to the priority button in the keyboard toolbar
  • Change: Tap the left side of a header or bullet to zoom and the right side to collapse
  • Change: Keyboard toolbar buttons are smaller with some secondary menus so it doesn’t have to scroll
  • Change: Breadcrumbs in the header for easy zooming out
  • Change: Updated design with white header and a border instead of shadow
  • Change: Moved toasts above the bottom bar
  • Change: Aligned collapser to the top of the text instead of centered
  • Fix: Items were sometimes not updating horizontal position after zoomin
  • Fix: Tapping a date in the Agenda now opens the date picker
  • Fix: Bottom bar was placed incorrectly on iPhone X
  • Fix: Prefixes were not vertically aligned correctly on Android
  • Fix: Status bar height was incorrect on iPhone X and was not hiding on rotation
  • Fix: Indent/outdent buttons were not re-rendering item immediately
  • Fix: Long press was much too sensitive
  • Fix: Agenda add button was not scrolling into view
  • Fix: Scrolls to top when zooming in/out
  • Fix: Inline elements tap handlers were overriding multiselection
  • Fix: Note did not inherit parent’s priority or star
  • Fix: Flat view was not immediately re-rendering flat

January 17

  • Fix: Tag and contact autocomplete in search were not inserting # or + characters
  • Fix: Tag autocomplete was not showing exact matches

January 14

  • Fix: Sidebar button text was turning into … at certain widths
  • Change: Boards with name length <= 2 characters don’t reduce font size

January 12

  • Feature: Board folders (Premium) - Right click on a board to add it to a folder. Click the folder to collapse it.
  • Feature: Clicking a sort mode a second time reverses the sort
  • Fix: Small sidebar was not persisting
  • Fix: Renaming boards was erroneously complaining about unique names
  • Fix: Deleting a note from the context menu was showing a ghost note popup

January 11

  • Fix: Mac app toolbar was offset as if in fullscreen after exiting fullscreen
  • Fix: Clicking in document name field while renaming was opening the document
  • Feature: Added a collapse button on the Trash, collapsed by default

Desktop apps 1.4.2

  • Fix: Fullscreen detection is now done natively so it won’t be broken by auto-hiding menu bar
  • Fix: Auto-updater is working again
  • Fix: Zoom in hotkey was not working

January 6

Mobile

  • Fix: Gmail pane was not immediately being added or removed after toggling Gmail plugin
  • Fix: Email and calendar sync were sometimes failing if sync data was invalid
  • Fix: Dragging to the end of a list was sometimes crashing
  • Fix: Dragging out of the clipboard was sometimes crashing

January 3

  • Fix: Revision history was crashing after the recent menu updates
  • Fix: Plaintext and HTML export were sometimes hanging for some users
  • Fix: Initial selection in intro popup was wrong
  • Fix: Tooltips were showing on tags in agenda settings

January 2

  • Fix: Gmail labels were sometimes failing to sync for secondary accounts
  • Fix: Added a FIX button to plugin sync account settings as a fallback in case of sync errors
  • Fix: Some minor styling of autocompletes was broken

January 1

  • Fix: The live demos are working again in the old blog posts: Moo.do for Kanban and Moo.do for Project Management

December 31

  • Fix: Date popup and some calendar views were crashing if you had set the “Start week on” setting since the recent settings UI update
  • Fix: Exiting date popup was not restoring selection properly

December 30

  • Fix: Email and calendar sync were sometimes failing if sync data was invalid

December 27

  • Fix: New item popup opened by hotkey wasn’t showing document selector
  • Fix: Creating a new document while offline and then adding items to it, and then going online, and then setting a document name was causing item text not to sync
  • Change: Redesigned settings UI to be easier to read and more attractive

December 23

Desktop apps 1.4.1

  • Feature: A setting to use the system light/dark theme
  • Feature: Global hotkeys for Create Item and Compose Email. See the Desktop App section of the settings to set the hotkeys.
  • Fix: Google authentication was showing an error when authorizing plugins for some people.

December 22

  • Change: Removed the new user Welcome screens and moved the Welcome steps into the Intro

December 21

Mobile

  • Fix: Rotation was sometimes causing item text to be cut off
  • Fix: Contacts and links were sometimes not opening their popups
  • Fix: Empty items had too much height

December 20

  • Feature: Added date created, modified, and completed info to the bottom of the item context menu
  • Feature: Added a compose email button to the top of an email pane, which uses that pane’s account as the From account
  • Feature: Added an Agenda Month view
  • Fix: Welcome screen was sometimes getting stuck in Connecting… after setting an encryption password
  • Fix: Setting an encryption password was immediately prompting to enter the password
  • Fix: Gmail search with no results was showing two status messages

December 16

  • Fix: Signing in to a new instance of Moo.do on an account with a user password was sometimes getting stuck at “Loading documents”

December 15

Mobile

  • Feature: Sync accounts can now be added and modified in the mobile apps
  • Fix: More stable sync with the new authentication system
  • Fix: Some text padding and display issues in the Agenda
  • Fix: Note preview showed some html and was not splitting lines
  • Fix: Prevent drag/dropping between an item and its note
  • Fix: Overview indentation sometimes messed up in Agenda
  • Fix: Collapsed email conversations now show a preview of the email content
  • Fix: Email previews handle rotation better

December 12

  • Feature: Added support for pressing Enter in List view
  • Fix: Dates and calendar events are generally more stable.
  • Fix: Some items were invisible on calendar month view
  • Fix: Selecting “Add to calendar” before entering a date was not adding the date to Google Calendar
  • Fix: Pressing the down arrow above an item with a plugin could set selection into the middle of the plugin, and then pressing enter would duplicate it

December 11

  • Fix: Plugin authentication uses a totally different method, which is more stable and less buggy
  • Fix: Plugin sync handles going online/offline better and is overall more reliable
  • Fix: Calendar plugin was clearing default save calendar if sync failed while offline

December 7

  • Change: New help popup in the bottom right which opens by default for new users, and is organized in a better order than the old help
  • Change: Changed default pane type to Outline
  • Change: Increased tooltip hover delay
  • Change: Addded spring effects to pane and overview positions, and to clicking the overview of a document
  • Feature: Grayed “Type / to see options” hint in empty items

December 2

See blog post for details: Mobile Speed

Mobile

  • Speed: Switched to a new custom local database which loads much faster
  • Speed: Improved speed of code bottlenecks in date parsing and date comparisons
  • Speed: Editing and item changes were previously affecting all panes but now only the active pane
  • Speed: Cache measured item heights and date calculations so it doesn’t need to be computed on every load

December 1

  • Change: Enable Plugins and Sync Accounts settings merged into a new Sync Plugins page, which feels much more intuitive
  • Fix: Add pane menu was always showing Email and Files even if plugins were disabled

November 27

  • Fix: Calendars shared with multiple Google accounts could sometimes conflict because they were duplicated in Moo.do
  • Fix: Items not matching the search filter were showing up in the overview if they were outside the visible tree of a deeply zoomed pane

November 26

  • Fix: Plugins sometimes stopped syncing after coming back from suspend
  • Fix: Emails and calendar events were sometimes not saving to the local cache properly
  • Fix: Added an option to calendar pane menu to force calendar sync to fix the local cache

November 15

July 18

  • Change: The “Complete” filter option now works like a normal filter (but reversed), because it was confusing that it worked differently than other filters, and new users got scared when items disappeared and couldn’t find the button to show them. When not enabled it shows everything, click hides completed, Cmd/Ctrl + click shows only completed. It’s set to hide completed by default, so new panes will have a red checkmark filter.
  • Change: The “Show top level projects” filter to be the opposite: “Show all projects.” So by default project panes will only show top level projects, and the filter option will also show children. New users were confused that their projects were showing up more than once.
  • Change: Filter buttons to be colored text instead of colored background, to reduce distraction.
  • Fix: Clicking contact email populates the To field in an email. And clicking the phone number opens a phone call.

July 17

  • Fix: Bugs in the authentication flow. If everything has been working fine for you, you should see no change. If you were having problems with plugins getting disabled, or emails not loading, or calendar not syncing correctly, you should now see a message about needing to reauthorize, and clicking the button will fix it. Please let us know if you see anything unusual, or if you’ve had these problems and they are not fixed now.
